questions.text: Which of the following best describes a network?
options: A. A collection of interconnected devices
questions.correctAnswer: A. A collection of interconnected devices
questions.explanation: A network is a collection of computers and devices connected together to share resources and information.

questions.text: True or False: A local area network (LAN) covers a larger geographic area than a wide area network (WAN).
questions.explanation: A LAN covers a smaller geographic area like a single building, while a WAN covers larger areas such as cities or countries.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a protocol used for transferring files over the Internet?
questions.explanation: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used to transfer files between computers over the Internet.

questions.text: Which device is used to amplify and regenerate network signals?
questions.explanation: Repeaters amplify and regenerate network signals to extend the range of a network.

questions.text: Which type of network topology has a central hub and nodes connected to it?
questions.explanation: In a star topology, each device is connected to a central hub, which manages data transmission.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to uniquely identify a device on a network?
questions.explanation: A MAC (Media Access Control) address is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface card (NIC).

questions.text: Which of the following protocols is commonly used to encrypt web traffic?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) encrypts web traffic for secure communication.

questions.text: True or False: A router is used to connect multiple networks together.
questions.explanation: Routers connect multiple networks and direct data between them.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a network topology?
questions.explanation: Pointer is not a network topology. The valid topologies include Bus, Star, Ring, and Mesh.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a firewall?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic to prevent unauthorized access.

questions.text: Which protocol is used for email transmission over the Internet?
questions.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used to send emails from a client to a server or between servers.

questions.text: Which of the following is a common wireless communication protocol?
questions.explanation: Bluetooth is a wireless communication protocol used for short-range data transmission.

questions.text: True or False: A mesh network topology connects each node to every other node in the network.
questions.explanation: In a mesh topology, each node is interconnected with every other node to ensure redundancy and reliability.

questions.text: Which type of device connects multiple computers in a network but does not manage data traffic?
questions.explanation: A hub connects multiple devices but does not manage data traffic like a switch or router.

questions.text: What is the role of DNS in a network?
options: C. To resolve domain names to IP addresses
questions.correctAnswer: C. To resolve domain names to IP addresses
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates domain names into IP addresses.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes an intranet?
options: B. A secure internal network within an organization
C. A network connecting different organizations
D. A network for storing backups
questions.correctAnswer: B. A secure internal network within an organization
questions.explanation: An intranet is a private network accessible only to an organization's employees or members.

questions.text: Which network device connects multiple networks and routes data between them?
questions.explanation: Routers connect different networks and route data based on IP addresses.

questions.text: Which of the following is a method for securing wireless networks?
options: B. Using the default router password
questions.explanation: WEP, WPA, and WPA2 encryption protocols are used to secure wireless networks.

questions.text: Which protocol is responsible for assigning IP addresses in a network?
questions.explanation: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) assigns IP addresses to devices on a network.

questions.text: True or False: An access point is used to extend the range of a wireless network.
questions.explanation: Access points are used to increase the range of wireless networks by connecting additional devices.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes bandwidth?
options: A. The physical size of a network
B. The number of devices on a network
C. The amount of data that can be transmitted over a network in a given time
D. The security level of a network
questions.correctAnswer: C. The amount of data that can be transmitted over a network in a given time
questions.explanation: Bandwidth is the maximum amount of data that can be transmitted over a network in a specific time period.

questions.text: Which of the following devices connects devices within the same network and manages traffic based on MAC addresses?
questions.explanation: Switches manage network traffic by forwarding data to specific devices based on their MAC addresses.

questions.text: Which of the following is a security protocol used to protect data during transmission?
questions.explanation: SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) and TLS (Transport Layer Security) are protocols used to encrypt data during transmission.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to create a secure connection over an unsecured network?
questions.explanation: A VPN (Virtual Private Network) creates a secure, encrypted connection over an unsecured network like the Internet.

questions.text: True or False: An IP address is a unique identifier for devices on a network.
questions.explanation: An IP address uniquely identifies devices on a network, allowing data to be sent and received.

questions.text: Which of the following network devices operates at the data link layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: Switches operate at the data link layer, forwarding data based on MAC addresses.

questions.text: Which of the following network components is used to protect against unauthorized access to a network?
questions.explanation: Firewalls monitor and control incoming and outgoing traffic to protect networks from unauthorized access.

questions.text: Which type of address is used to uniquely identify a device within a local network?
questions.explanation: MAC (Media Access Control) addresses uniquely identify devices within a local network.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a virtual private network (VPN)?
options: B. A private network accessible through the Internet
C. A network for local devices only
questions.correctAnswer: B. A private network accessible through the Internet
questions.explanation: A VPN allows secure remote access to a private network over the Internet.

questions.text: Which of the following is used to resolve domain names to IP addresses?
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) resolves domain names to their corresponding IP addresses.

questions.text: Which protocol is used to secure data transferred between web browsers and servers?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is used to encrypt data transferred between web browsers and servers.
